column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 2. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 3. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column8: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: Road curves ahead

column2: 5. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 6. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 7. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: minimum speed

column2: 8. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column8: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column10: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.

column2: 9. Smoking while driving:
column8: helps increase driver alertness.

column2: 10. Regulation signs normallyÂ are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column8: green; white

column2: 11. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: the pavement ends.

column2: 12. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column8: green, yellow and red.

column2: 13. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column8: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 14. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a side road.

column2: 17. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver who does not control the car.
column8: The driver on the right.

column2: 18. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 19. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 20. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 21. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: regulatory signs.

column2: 22. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column10: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column8: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 24. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 25. Warning signs normally are:
column8: diamond-shaped.
